meanings.definition: A notch or indentation in a surface
meanings.sent1: The old wooden door had a crena at the bottom where it had been scratched.
meanings.sent2: She ran her finger along the crena in the rock, feeling the smooth groove.
meanings.sent3: The crena in the cake made it look like a smiley face, much to the delight of the children.
meanings.sent4: His wrinkled hands resembled the crena of a tree trunk, showing years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The crena in the paper was a perfect place to tuck a small note.

meanings.definition: A small, rounded projection or tooth on the edge of a leaf or petal
meanings.sent1: The crena on the leaf made it look like a tiny crown.
meanings.sent2: The delicate flower petal had a tiny crena that caught the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar used the crena on the leaf as a cozy hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: Her smile revealed a charming crena that added to her beauty.
meanings.sent5: The crena on the petal was so small, it was easy to miss at first glance.
